snippet: President Obama and Mitt Romney won roughly an equal number of votes among straight voters, but the president carried the gay vote three to one.
abstract: President Obama and Mitt Romney won roughly equal number of votes among straight voters, but the president carried the gay vote 76 percent to 22 percent, among 5 percent of voters who identified themselves as gay, lesbian or bisexual.
lead_paragraph: President Obama and Mitt Romney won roughly an equal number of votes among straight voters, but the president carried the gay vote three to one.

headline.main: Gay Vote Proved a Boon for Obama
headline.print_headline: Gay Support Buoyed Obama, as the Straight Vote Split
